typedef const void* cEntity_Handle
 

An const opaque object containing enough information for the underlying implementation to determine a unique entity.

This is used to distinquish which subroutines can change the opaque object and which cannot.

Definition at line 94 of file TSTT_Core.h.

typedef void* MeshError
 

An opaque object containing information about errors generated in a TSTT method call.

This will be NULL for successful calls; non-null if an error is generated. Methods for checking the error status are provided.

Definition at line 101 of file TSTT_Core.h.

typedef void ErrorCallbackFunction(MeshError *error)

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum EntityType
 

TSTT supports zero-, one-, two-, and three-dimensional entities associated with a mesh infrastructure, we allow users to access these dimensional entities using the enumerated type EntityType which contains.

Parameters:
VERTEX  a zero-dimensional entity (value=0)
EDGE  a one-dimensional entity (value=1)
FACE  a two-dimensional entity (value=2)
REGION  a three-dimensional entity (value=3)
NUMBER_OF_ENTITY_TYPES  the number of entities (value=4)
Enumeration values:
VERTEX 
EDGE 
FACE 
REGION 
NUMBER_OF_ENTITY_TYPES 

Definition at line 14 of file TSTT_Core.h.

00017     EDGE=              1,
00018     FACE=              2,
00019     REGION=            3,
00020     NUMBER_OF_ENTITY_TYPES= 4
00021   };

enum EntityTopology
 

An enumerated list of topological TSTT entities.

Note that not all TSTT meshes need to support all of these element types, but they do need to be able to answer questions such as: how many elements of each type do you have? and return the appropriate type for entity handles

So far we agreed to enumerate the following types - more could be defined as time progresses.

Parameters:
POLYGON  a general two-dimensional element (value=7)
TRIANGLE  a three-sided, two-dimensional element (value=8)
QUADRILATERAL  a four-sided, two-dimensional element (value=9)
POLYHEDRAL  a general three-dimensional element (value=10)
TETRAHDRON  a four-sided, three-dimensional element whose faces are triangles (value=11)
HEXAHEDRON  a six-sided, three-dimensional element whose faces are quadrilaterals (value=12)
PRISM  a five-sided, three-dimensional element which has three quadrilateral faces and two triangular faces (value=13)
PYRAMID  a four-sided, three-dimensional element which has one quadrilateral face and three triangular faces (value=14)
SEPTAHEDRON  a seven-sided, three-dimensional element which has one hexagonal face and six triangular faces (value=15)
Enumeration values:
POLYGON 
TRIANGLE 
QUADRILATERAL 
POLYHEDRON 
TETRAHEDRON 
HEXAHEDRON 
PRISM 
PYRAMID 
SEPTAHEDRON

Function Documentation

void Mesh_Create (  Mesh_Handle *    mesh,
MeshError *    errorReturn
) 
 

Create a TSTT mesh.

This method must be called before any other TSTT methods.

Parameters:
mesh  (out) the pointer to the TSTT mesh interface to be created. No information will be loaded until Mesh_Load is called.
errorReturn  (out) the error object; will be NULL if successful, non-NULL otherwise.

void Mesh_Load (  cMesh_Handle    mesh,
const char *    name,
MeshError *    errorReturn
) 
 

Load information into a TSTT mesh.

This method must be called after Mesh_Create and before any other methods can be called to access mesh or entity information. Note that multiple Mesh_Load calls can be made for a given Mesh_Handle. It is assumed that the union of information from each load call will be available in Mesh_Handle in the other TSTT methods.

Parameters:
mesh  (in) the handle to the TSTT mesh for which information is to be loaded.
name  (in) a string identifier for which mesh to load, for example from a file.
errorReturn  (out) the error object; will be NULL if successful, non-NULL otherwise.

void Mesh_Services_GetInt (  cMesh_Handle    mesh,
const char *    key,
Int *    value,
MeshError *    errorReturn
) 
 

A services method for getting integer information based on a string key value.

String values that are currently supported include "number of 0D entities" or "number of vertices" "number of 1D entities" or "number of edges" "number of 2D entities" or "number of faces" "number of 3D entities" or "number of regions"

It is anticipated that this function can be easily expanded to include other required key value pairs.

Parameters:
mesh  (in) the handle to the TSTT mesh for which information is requested.
key  (in) the string identifier for the requested information
value  (out) the returned value
errorReturn  (out) the error object; will be NULL if successful, non-NULL otherwise.

void Mesh_Services_GetFloat (  cMesh_Handle    mesh,
const char *    key,
Float *    value,
MeshError *    errorReturn
) 
 

A services method for getting float information based on a string key value.

No string key values for this function are supported at this time.

Parameters:
mesh  (in) the handle to the TSTT mesh for which information is requested.
key  (in) the string identifier for the requested information
value  (out) the returned value
errorReturn  (out) the error object; will be NULL if successful, non-NULL otherwise.

void Mesh_Services_GetDouble (  cMesh_Handle    mesh,
const char *    key,
Double *    value,
MeshError *    errorReturn
) 
 

A services method for getting double information based on a string key value.

No string key values for this function are supported at this time.

Parameters:
mesh  (in) the handle to the TSTT mesh for which information is requested.
key  (in) the string identifier for the requested information
value  (out) the returned value
errorReturn  (out) the error object; will be NULL if successful, non-NULL otherwise.

void Mesh_GetEntities (  cMesh_Handle    mesh,
const EntityType    entity_type,
Entity_Handle **    entity_handles,
Int *    num_entities,
MeshError *    errorReturn
) 
 

Gets an array of entity handles representing all of the entities of type entity_type.

Parameters:
mesh  (in) the handle to the TSTT mesh for which information is requested.
entity_type  (in) one of the enumerated types given TSTT_0D_ENTITY, TSTT_1D_ENTITY, TSTT_2D_ENTITY, TSTT_3D_ENTITY or TSTT_VERTEX, TSTT_EDGE, TSTT_FACE, TSTT_REGION
entity_handles  (out) the array of opaque entity handles
num_entities  (inout) the number of entities in the array If num_entities=0 on input, the mesh allocates the entity_handles array. If num_entities>=actual on input, it is expected that the application passes in an array of that size, and the mesh fills it. If num_entities<actual, an error is returned.
errorReturn  (out) the error object; will be NULL if successful, non-NULL otherwise.

void Mesh_GetEntityAdjacency (  cMesh_Handle    mesh,
const EntityType    entity_type_requestor,
const EntityType    entity_type_requested,
Entity_Handle **    entity_handles,
Int **    csr_pointer,
Int **    csr_data,
Int *    num_entities,
MeshError *    errorReturn
) 
 

Get the adjacenty list for the entities of the TSTT Mesh.

The entities are returned in the form of an array of EntityHandles which uniquely identify each mesh entity of a given type. We return the data in compressed sparse row (CSR) format. In this format three arrays are returned: csr_index: an integer array giving the location in the index array beginning each entity's adjacency list. For example, the starting point of the adjacencies for entity k (as given in csr_adjacencies array) is given by csr_index[k], and the number of adjacencies is given by csr_index[k+1]-csr_index[k]. csr_adjacencies: an integer array giving the locations of the adjacent entities in the entity_handles array entity_handles: the array containing unique identifiers for the requested adjacent entities

For example to request the vertex adjacency information of two triangles and a quadrilateral (the two triangles share vertices 1 and 2, the quadrilateral shares vertices 2 and three whith the second triangle) The csr_index array is 0, 3, 6, 10 The csr_adjacencies array is 0 1 2 1 2 3 2 3 4 5 The entity_handles array contains 6 elements uniquely identifying the vertices of the elements

Parameters:
mesh  (in) the handle to the TSTT mesh for which information is requested.
entity_type_requestor  (in) one of the enumerated types VERTEX, EDGE, FACE, REGION. This is the entity which is requesting the adjacency information (in the example above, FACE)
entity_type_requested  (in) one of the enumerated types VERTEX, EDGE, FACE, REGION. This is the entity which is requested (in the example above, VERTEX)
entity_handles  (out) the array of unique entity handles for the requested adjacencies
entity_handles  (out): the array containing unique identifiers for the requested adjacent entities
csr_poiner  (out) an integer array that gives the number of entities adjacent to each requestor
csr_data  (out) an integer array giving the locations of the adjacent entities in the entity_handles array
num_entities  (inout) the number of entities in the array If num_entities=0 on input, the mesh allocates the entity_handles array. If num_entities>=actual on input, it is expected that the application passes in an array of that size, and the mesh fills it. If num_entities<actual, an error is returned.
errorReturn  (out) the error object; will be NULL if successful, non-NULL otherwise.

void Mesh_GetCoordinates (  cMesh_Handle    mesh,
double *    coordinates,
char *    options,
MeshError *    errorReturn
) 
 

Get the coordinates of the vertices.

Return an array of vertex coordinates that will be indexed with a global or local ID. The user may choose the storage order to be either interleaved, xyzxyzxyz storage or blocked, xxxyyyzzz storage. It is assumed that the coordinates are returned in a fixed order that will be reproduced if no mesh modifications have occurred between calls.

Parameters:
mesh  (in) the handle to the TSTT mesh for which information is requested.
coordinates  (input/output): If this array is allocated on input then the results will be copied to this array if it is big enough, otherwise an error is issued. If this array has not been allocated space on input then the space will be allocated by this routine.
options  (input) : string containing options separated by semi-colons, options="option1; option2; ..." option = "interleaved" : vertices will be returned as xyzxyzxyz... option = "blocked" : vertices will be returned as xxxx..xyyyy...yzzzz...z option = "range(n1:n2)" : return the vertices in the range n1,n1+1,...,n2 option = "local" : return the vertices local to this processor option = "includeHigherOrderNodes" : return nodes used by higher order elements -- this option needs to be worked out more carefully to specify exactly where the higher-order nodes sit etc. Example: options="interleaved; range(0:1000)" will return vertices 0 to 1000 in the interleaved format.
errorReturn  (out) the error object; will be NULL if successful, non-NULL otherwise.

void Mesh_GetEntityIndicies (  cMesh_Handle    mesh,
const EntityType    entityType,
int *    count,
int *    index,
char *    options,
MeshError *    errorReturn
) 
 

Return the indicies of the verticies that define all entities of a given type.

The index values (i.e. the global or local ID of a vertex) for entity i are given by (assuming a compressed-row format) : index[e1],...,index[e2-1] where e1=count[i], e2=count[i+1]

Parameters:
mesh  (in) the handle to the TSTT mesh for which information is requested.
entityType  (in) one of the enumerated types VERTEX, EDGE, FACE, REGION. This is the entity which is requesting the adjacency information (in the example above, FACE)
count  (input): array to place results in. Usual behaviour depending on whether array has been allocated or not (see above).
index  (input) : array to place results in. Usual behaviour depending on whether array has been allocated or not (see above).
options  (input) : a list of options, separated by semi-colons options="option1; option2; ...". option = "csr" : return in compressed-row format option = "expanded" : return in uncompressed format option = "HEXAHEDRON" : return only those regions that are also hexahedra. option = "includeHigherOrderNodes" : return nodes used by higher order elements -- this option needs to be worked out more carefully to specify exactly where the higher-order nodes sit etc.
errorReturn  (out) the error object; will be NULL if successful, non-NULL otherwise.

void Mesh_GetEntityAdjacencyIndicies (  cMesh_Handle    mesh,
const EntityType    entityType,
const EntityType    entityAdjacencyType,
int *    count,
int *    index,
char *    options,
MeshError *    errorReturn
) 
 

Return adjacency information.

Example: To return the list of faces that are adjacent to all regions one would set entityType=REGION, entityAdjacencyType=FACE.

The index values for the adjacency i (numbered according to the order they are returned in the call to getEntitiesIndicies) are given by (assumming a compressed-row format) index[e1],...,index[e2-1] where e1=count[i], e2=count[i+1]

Parameters:
mesh  (in) the handle to the TSTT mesh for which information is requested.
entityType  (in): Return adjacency info for this type of entity.
entityAdjacencyType  (in) : Return adjacency info of entities of this type.
count  (inout): array to place results in. Usual behaviour depending on whether array has been allocated or not (see above).
index  (out): array to place results in. Usual behaviour depending on whether array has been allocated or not (see above).
options  (in) : a list of options, separated by semi-colons, options="option1; option2; ...". option = "csr" : return in compressed-row format option = "expanded" : return in uncompressed format option = "includeHigherOrderNodes" : return nodes used by higher order elements -- this option needs to be worked out more carefully to specify exactly where the higher-order nodes sit etc.
errorReturn  (out) the error object; will be NULL if successful, non-NULL otherwise.

void Mesh_FreeEntityHandles (  Entity_Handle *    entity_handles,
MeshError *    errorReturn
) 
 

Frees the information in the entity_handles array.

Note that this does not delete the entities themselves, merely the opaque pointers to them.

Parameters:
entity_handles  (in) the array to free.
errorReturn  (out) the error object; will be NULL if successful, non-NULL otherwise.

void Mesh_FreeEntityAdjacency (  Entity_Handle *    entity_handles,
Int *    csr_pointer,
Int *    csr_data,
MeshError *    errorReturn
) 
 

Frees the information in the entity_adjacencies arrays.

Note that this does not delete the adjacent entities, merely the index arrays and opaque pointers associated with them.

Parameters:
entity_handles  (in) the array of opaque entity handles to free.
csr_poiner  (in) an integer array giving the number of entities adjacent to each requestor to free
csr_data  (in) an integer array giving the locations of the adjacent entities in the entity_handles array to free
errorReturn  (out) the error object; will be NULL if successful, non-NULL otherwise.

void Entity_GetGlobalID (  cEntity_Handle    entity_handle,
Int *    ID,
MeshError *    errorReturn
) 
 

OPTIONAL FUNCTION that returns an integer ID for an opaque entity type that is unique among entities of the same dimension.

Parameters:
entity_handle  (in) the opaque entity handle
ID  (out) the integer ID
errorReturn  (out) the error object; will be NULL if successful, non-NULL otherwise.

void Entity_GetDimension (  cEntity_Handle    entity_handle,
Int *    dim,
MeshError *    errorReturn
) 
 

Returns an integer dimension for an opaque entity type.

Parameters:
entity_handle  (in) the opaque entity handle
dim  (out) the integer dimension, 0 for VERTEX, 1 for EDGE, 2 for FACE, and 3 for REGION
errorReturn  (out) the error object; will be NULL if successful, non-NULL otherwise.

void Entity_GetType (  cEntity_Handle    entity_handle,
EntityType *    type,
MeshError *    errorReturn
) 
 

Get the type of the entity given by entity_handle.

The value is returned as an enumerated type: one of VERTEX= 0, EDGE= 1, FACE= 2, REGION= 3

Parameters:
entity_handle  (in) the opaque entity handle
type  (out) the type of the entity
errorReturn  (out) the error object; will be NULL if successful, non-NULL otherwise.

void Entity_GetToplogy (  cEntity_Handle    entity_handle,
EntityTopology *    topology,
MeshError *    errorReturn
) 
 

Get the topology of the entity given by entity_handle.

This is primarily for two- and three-dimensional entities and the value is returned as an enumerated type: one of POLYGON= 7, TRIANGLE= 8, QUADRILATERAL= 9, POLYHEDRON= 10, TETRAHEDRON= 11, HEXAHEDRON= 12, PRISM= 13, PYRAMID= 14, SEPTAHEDRON= 15 where these types are enumerated integers.

Parameters:
entity_handle  (in) the opaque entity handle
topology  (out) the topology of the entity
errorReturn  (out) the error object; will be NULL if successful, non-NULL otherwise.

void Entity_GetVertexCoords (  cEntity_Handle    entity_handle,
Double **    coords,
Int *    num_coords,
MeshError *    errorReturn
) 
 

Get the coordinates of a vertex mesh entity given by entity_handle.

Parameters:
entity_handle  (in) the opaque entity handle, must be a vertex
coords  (inout) a double array containing the vertex coordinates
num_coords  (inout) an integer giving the number of coordinates in the array If num_coords=0, the mesh allocates the array If num_coords>=dimension, the application passes in an array of that size, and the mesh fills it If num_coords<dimension requested, an error is returned
errorReturn  (out) the error object; will be NULL if successful, non-NULL otherwise.

void Entity_GetNumAdjacencies (  cEntity_Handle    entity_handle,
const EntityType    entity_type,
Int *    num_entities,
MeshError *    errorReturn
) 
 

Returns the number of adjacenct entities of a given dimension for the requesting mesh entity.

Parameters:
entity_handle  (in): a handle that uniquely identifies a TSTT entity; this is the requesting mesh entity
entity_type  (in) the type of desired adjacencies
num_entities  (out) the number of adjacent entities
errorReturn  (out) the error object; will be NULL if successful, non-NULL otherwise.

void Entity_GetAdjacencies (  cEntity_Handle    entity_handle,
const EntityType    entity_type,
Entity_Handle **    adj_entities_handle,
Int *    num_adjacent,
MeshError *    errorReturn
) 
 

Returns the number of adjacent entities of a given dimension of the requesting mesh entity and an array of unique identifiers of the adjacent entities.

Parameters:
entity_handle  (in): a handle that uniquely identifies a TSTT entity; this is the requesting mesh entity
entity_type  (in) the type of desired adjacencies
adj_entities_handle  (out) the array of opaque pointers containing the adjacent entity information
num_entities  (out) the number of adjacent entities If num_entities=0, the mesh allocates the adj_entities_handle array If num_entities>=actual, the application is assumed to have passed in an array for adj_entities_handle of that size, and the mesh fills it If num_entities<actual, an error is returned
errorReturn  (out) the error object; will be NULL if successful, non-NULL otherwise.

MeshError *    errorReturn
) 
 

Destroys the mesh information that is referenced by the opaque mesh handle mesh.

Parameters:
mesh  (in) the handle to the TSTT mesh for which information is requested.
errorReturn  (out) the error object; will be NULL if successful, non-NULL otherwise.
